source.description: Where the recipe came from. Usually a URL, can also be text (eg. a book title).

source.name.description: Where the recipe came from. Usually a URL, can also be text (eg. a book title).

source.url.description: The URL of the recipe if nested format is used.

servings.description: Indicates how many people the recipe is for. Used for scaling quantities. Leading number is used for scaling, anything else is ignored but shown as units.

serves.description: Indicates how many people the recipe is for. Used for scaling quantities. Leading number is used for scaling, anything else is ignored but shown as units.

yield.description: Indicates how many people the recipe is for. Used for scaling quantities. Leading number is used for scaling, anything else is ignored but shown as units.

locale.description: The locale of the recipe. Used for spelling/grammar during edits, and for pluralisation of amounts. Uses ISO 639 language code, then optionally an underscore and the ISO 3166 alpha2 'country code' for dialect variants

time required.description: The preparation + cook time of the recipe. Various formats can be parsed, if in doubt use `HhMm` format to avoid plurals and locales.

time.description: The preparation + cook time of the recipe. Various formats can be parsed, if in doubt use `HhMm` format to avoid plurals and locales.

duration.description: The preparation + cook time of the recipe. Various formats can be parsed, if in doubt use `HhMm` format to avoid plurals and locales.

diet.description: Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe or menu item is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.

examples: This recipe is a traditional Uzbek dish that is made with a variety of vegetables and meat.
